comment: He is not the worst. but it is a lot of homework. Plus the projects given were very annoying and the exams had to be done under 1 hour and 15 which was not enough time.

The professor didn't do anything for this class. However it was setup in a previous semester. Basically you just read to the book and follow the tutorial to learn the material. Took a long time to get grades back, which means you completed many assignments before any feedback was given. Not a bad class.

take him if you seriously want to learn, my group worked our a off to get A in his classes and not regret a second of it. if you want to be another snowflake and expect an easy core engineering class which taught by one of the top guys of the department, dont waste his time and leave that spot for someone who willing to learn

He has zero soft skills. He is rude and condescending when giving what he calls "feedback," and doesn't have the industry experience to be overseeing SD projects. Instead of being inspirational, he is the type of professor that makes people switch from engineering to business. I'm glad I won't have to see him ever again. Avoid him if you can.

Professor Sooklol is quick to respond to an email, but the email is usually not helpful. The homework assignments (2 a week) take an average of 4 hours each. The group project he often changes his mind of what's required without much warning. This was definitely my most stressful class at KSU yet. I do not recommend this professor for this class.

Lectures are great, he knows how to explain concepts well. He's good at answering questions. He writes out lecture notes on the board with you so he can explain it as he goes. Lots of HW & sometimes we don't cover enough material in class to understand it before its due. Tests are fair, there aren't any curveballs. Reasonable & laid back
rating_tags: Accessible outside class--Clear grading criteria--Amazing lectures

comment: Avoid this professor as best as you can. He's not responsive and will not answer any questions that you ask. He sucks ass. He did not look at the facts and will say you violates the rule. I tried to ask some questions about the homework and he basically will not help and blaming you not study hard enough. What a great professor.
One of the best professors in KSU ME department. Makes you work for your grade but you will learn a lot. Doesn't waste any time in class and is well organized. Take him for every class you can.

Machine Design is a hard class in itself. Sooklal gives hard/long hw assignments and you need to understand them for the test. If you understand the hardest problems, you will do well on the tests. He is good at explaining the material and working examples. Gives 2 Tests and Project + Final. I would recommend him but you must put in the work.
rating_tags: Tough Grader--Skip class? You won't pass.--LOTS OF HOMEWORK

comment: The best Professor for Machine Design, he will make you work hard for your grade but at the same time gives you a bonus question on final which replaces the lowest scored question on the test. I wish I had take other classes with Dr. Sooklal, the most knowledge person I have met at KSU ME department.

Before the first Exam he will rush through subjects he says we should've learned in previous classes, be ready to learn all that material at home. Lots of HWs, only the harder questions, nothing like problems covered in class.  Beware, may assign 2 HWs and a project through Thanksgiving Break. No Quizzes.
rating_tags: Tough Grader--Skip class? You won't pass.--LOTS OF HOMEWORK

comment: Most knowledgable professor in the ME department. Amazing at explaining even the most difficult concepts. If you want to learn definitely take him. If I can go back I would take him for every engineering class that he teaches. You are welcome, no need to thank me.

Lectures are boring, but the material he quizzes on is usually pretty basic. To be honest, while the class would be fairly difficult without a formula sheet, it's actually pretty trivial with one. All you need to do is remember your units!
